title: Director of Design
description: I stepped into an interim-turned-permanent role after the departure of the VP of Design — it was a great opportunity to learn a very different level of design and leadership.
responsibilities: Translated company strategies into prioritized initiatives, led division of 40+ designers, managed $3.8M budget, $2M/year in revenue
Built Research team and capabilities (tooling, repositories) to bring our customer’s voice to every team
Collaborated with Design leads to develop KPIs for Design Systems and Brand for a more data informed approach

title: Principal Designer
description: As Principal Designer, I continued to manage Product Design teams, while establishing and leading our Design Ops function. One of my key contributions was setting the vision for a new version our Design System, rethinking how a design system can add value beyond a product organization and becoming a key value prop for enterprise customers.
responsibilities: Managed Product Design teams, developed and hired managers
Established Design Ops function to foster interdisciplinary collaboration, alignment in design systems and brand, and scale processes
Led the productization of our design system, started evolution of Design Systems team from cost center to profit center
Led designers in platform quality initiative that directly contributed to company exceeding revenue targets by almost 20%
key_contributions: Rethinking how a design system can add value beyond a product organization
Becoming a key value prop for enterprise customers

title: Senior Product Design Manager
description: While still working on select product and consulting projects, I began managing internationally and helped grow and lead other managers.
responsibilities: Worked with Liferay’s first VP of Design to establish Design as a division with Brand and Product departments
Developed remote operating policies and hired internationally in Brazil, Spain, and Japan
Built consulting practice in APAC, generated $250k revenue in 1st year

title: UX Design Manager
description: After spending 3 years gaining a deep understanding of our product and customers in my role as Web Designer, I moved to a product team tasked with developing an MVP for an entirely new product line. I also grew the UX team based in our LA office from 4 to 8.
responsibilities: Collaborated closely with Product and Engineering leads, led design for successful launch of Liferay’s first SaaS product MVP
Designed and developed a growth framework for the UX department
Built consulting practice in NA, generated $200k revenue in 1st year

title: Web Designer
description: Liferay’s first web designer, initially hired to support our marketing efforts, I quickly grew my responsibilities to include all web properties, built Liferay’s first web style guide and hired my first two designers.
